topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 1.0: Installation and Configuration for ESX Hypervisor

body.p: HPE Helion OpenStack allows you to manage the ESX hypervisor, manage the VMware vCenter, and provision virtual machines. This document provides installation instructions for HPE Helion OpenStack on a suitably specified and prepared system.

section.title: Installing HPE Helion OpenStack
section.p: The installation and configuration process for ESX consists of the following general steps:

ul.li:
Preparing for installation
Verify Prerequisites
Review the ESX deployment architecture
Edit the JSON environment variables file
Prepare baremetal.csv file
Set DNS servers
Preparing seed cloud host to run seed VM
Download and extracting the installation packages

Installing HPE Helion OpenStack
Configure proxy information
Install the seed VM and building your cloud

section.title: Preparing for installation
section.p: Before starting the installation, review the following sections.

section.title: Verify Prerequisites
section.p: To ensure successful installation, perform required pre-installation tasks before you start.

section.title: Review the ESX deployment architecture
section.p: The following diagram depicts the required network topology for a ESX installation.
HPE Helion OpenStack architecture diagram for ESX
For detailed network requirements, see Installation: Prerequisites.

section.title: Edit the JSON environment variables file
section.p: Before installing, make sure you have edited the JSON environment variables file that is required for installation.
For more information, see Editing the JSON Environment Variables File for Installation.

section.title: Prepare baremetal.csv file
section.p: Before installing, make sure you have created the baremetal.csv file that is required for installation.
For more information, see Creating the baremetal.csv file in HPE Helion OpenStack Installation: Prerequisites.

section.title: Set DNS servers
section.p: To set a default DNS name server for your HPE Helion OpenStack Commercial cloud, refer to Enabling Name Resolution from Tenant VMs in the Overcloud before installation.

section.title: Prepare the seed cloud host to create the seed VM
section.p: On the server identified to run the seed VM, called the seed cloud host (or installation system), make sure that Ubuntu 14.04 LTS Server edition is installed and operating, as listed in Installation: Prerequisites.

section.title: Downloading and extracting the installation packages
section.p: Before you begin, you must have downloaded and extracted the required HPE Helion OpenStack installation packages. See Installation: Prerequisites.

section.title: Installing HPE Helion OpenStack
section.p: Make sure you have met all the hardware requirements and have completed the required tasks before you begin your installation. The following sections walk you through the steps to be executed on the seed cloud host:

li.xref: Installing the seed VM and building your cloud

section.title: Configure proxy information
section.p: Before you begin your installation on the seed cloud host, if necessary configure the proxy information for your environment using the following steps:

li.p: Launch a terminal and log in to your seed cloud host as root:
Edit the /etc/environment file to add the following lines:

codeblock.codeph: export http_proxy=http://<web_proxy_IP>/ export https_proxy=http://<web_proxy_IP>/ export no_proxy=localhost,127.0.0.1,<your 10.x IP address>,<provider_network>

li.p: Where:

codeblock.codeph: web_proxy_IP is your web proxy IP address. provider_Network is your ESX management network

li.p: Log out and re-login to the seed cloud host to activate the proxy configuration.

section.title: Verify your installation
section.p: To verify that the installation is successful, connect to the HPE Helion OpenStack dashboard and the undercloud dashboard as shown in Verifying your installation.

section.title: Create projects for LDAP users
section.p: If you are integrating LDAP into your environment, you need to configure the Horizon dashboard for users. For more information, see Configure Horizon on the Integrating LDAP page.

li.p: Deploy vCenter ESX Compute Proxy (REQUIRED)

The HPE Helion OpenStack vCenter ESX compute proxy is a driver that enables the Compute service to communicate with a VMware vCenter server that manages one or more ESX hosts. The HPE Helion OpenStack Compute service (Nova) requires this driver to interface with VMWare ESX hypervisor APIs.
See Deploy vCenter ESX compute proxy.
